title: Razor-like syntax in XAML
body: I would like to use data-binding with Razor syntax similar to what  ASP.Net MVC has. The binding syntax should support Intellisense. When binding class is optionally specified, the compiler should do static type-checking and produce build errors when binding is invalid.

comments.body:
Yea kinda had this idea for a few weeks, also, bump.
This can also begin a new era within which DP and XAML styling will be replaced by CSS-like Razor stylesheets (as seen in React Native).

Definitely like this idea. This could possible reduce quite a bit of verbosity on XAML especially on converters, conditional XAML, and x:bind since it uses an already mature language from .Net be it C# F# VB.Net etc...
Also having "conditional" statements in Xaml to define what Xaml gets rendered, that would be so useful in a number of situations one being the decision of what datatemplate to use
I definitely like the idea of razor for Xaml.
